name: ml-service-api
tagline: The ML service API allows anyone to use machine-learning based automated classification.
body:
### Overview
The ML service API allows anyone to use machine-learning based automated classification. This automated classification can work on both free text (essays, content, etc), and on numeric values.

The software uses artificial intelligence to grade student essays and short written answers, freeing professors for other tasks. The instant-grading software will be a useful pedagogical tool, enabling students to take tests and write essays over and over and improve the quality of their answers. 

With increasingly large class sizes, it is impossible for most teachers to give students meaningful feedback on writing assignments. This technology will offer distinct advantages over the traditional classroom system, where students often wait days or weeks for grades. 

### Getting started

This command is used to clone the code repo:

```
$ git clone git://github.com/edx/ml-service-api.git
```

After cloning the repo, please refer to the documentation below for full install directions.

### Documentation
All the docs can be found on the [Readthedocs](http://ml-api.readthedocs.org/) site.

### IRC channel
Join the conversation in the ##edxml channel on irc.freenode.net. You can connect using the [webchat](http://webchat.freenode.net?randomnick=1&channels=%23%23edxml&uio=d4) if you don't have an IRC client installed.

### Mailing list
Subscribe to the [edX code mailing list](https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!forum/edx-code) to stay up-to-date with the latest developments and participate in the discussion.

### Test coverage
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/edx/ml-service-api.png?branch=dev)](https://travis-ci.org/edx/ml-service-api)

The tests are run automatically using [TravisCI](https://travis-ci.org/). You can run them manually with:

```
$ python manage.py test --settings=ml_service_api.test_settings
```

### Around the web

- [Essay-Grading Software Offers Professors a Break](http://www.nytimes.com/2013/04/05/science/new-test-for-computers-grading-essays-at-college-level.html) article from New York Times (Apr. 4, 2013)
- [Contrasting State-of-the-Art Automated Scoring of Essays: Analysis](http://www.scribd.com/doc/91191010/Mark-d-Shermis-2012-contrasting-State-Of-The-Art-Automated-Scoring-of-Essays-Analysis) by Mark D. Shermis
